results.title: Boxing for boys: attack, defence and ringcraft
results.creator_credit: Colin Bell, Frank Wells and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the chief form of attack and defence; section of the glove to be used in hitting, portion of the body to be hit; correct stance; the straight left; the right hook; the swing; a lead and an uppercut; side stepping; the cross counter; the parry, blocking; slipping and ducking.

results.title: Boxes...boxes...boxes
results.creator_credit: Sue Wilson, Robin Dove and Coincidence Productions
results.brief_description: Shows a highschool “art event” at Hyde Park, Sydney. Includes the human sandwich, capturing space in boxes, man’s ordered existence, a 50 foot long piece of weaving, and seeing the environment from a new viewpoint.

results.title: Box kite to swing wing
results.brief_description: A history of the Royal Australian Air Force from the original Australian Flying Corps to todays modern aircraft of Macchi jet trainers, medium range Hercules and Iriquois helicopters. Shows their operations in World Wars I and II, Korea, Malaya and Vietnam plus their peacetime operations.

results.title: Bowling action
results.creator_credit: Denys Parsons, Brian Smith, Dorothy Grayson, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and Realist Films
results.brief_description: An analysis of the slow-medium bowling action of Ray Smith of Essex. The movements of Smith’s body in a run-up and delivery are shown and analysed, using normal speed, slow motion, and suspended shots. At four key positions of the action, H.P. Crabtree illustrates a method by which boys can obtain concentrated practice in pitching the ball for both length and direction. Commentary by John Arlott and filmed on location at Lord’s (MCC), the home of cricket.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Denys Parsons, Brian Smith, Dorothy Grayson, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and Realist Films

results.title: Bovine contagious pleuropneumonia
results.brief_description: This film traces the introduction and spread of the disease throughout Australia; why it persists in the north and how in spite of all precautions it occasionally infiltrates to the south. The main section of the film depicts in detail the characteristic symptoms and post-mortem findings, the effectiveness of vaccination, and the nature of present and past research work of the Division of Animal Health and Production.

results.title: Famous boundary of creation
results.brief_description: Documents the French-American study of the mid-Atlantic ridge. Illustrates plate tectonics. Underwater photography is used in this geological study. Photography includes, Iceland, Hawaii and Azores.

results.title: Boston Symphony Orchestra
results.brief_description: The Boston Symphony Orchestra in Japan in 1960, conducted by Charles Munch and Aaron Copland, includes performances of sections of major works with narration kept to a minimum. Includes complete movements or sections from the following: Easley Blackwood Jnr - “Symphony No. 1”; Hector Berlioz - “Symphony Fantastique”; Aaron Copland - “The Tender Land”; Claude Debussy - Symphonic Poem “La Mer”.

results.title: Bossa pop
results.creator_credit: Sheldon Cohen, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Three animated figures, a man, a woman and a child, dance, arms and legs flying, to the compulsive rhythms of this Bossa Pop. A light film in carnival mood - who can remain still when the music commands? A film without words.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sheldon Cohen, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Born to boats
results.brief_description: Depicts the British as a people born to boats. Shows designing, process of vuilding, and use of yachts, lifeboats, racing shells, and other small craft. Scenes include yacht-racing at Cowes, Uffa Fox designing new speed-boats including Donald Campbell in his turbo jet boat “Bluebird” with his record breaking run at 204 mph, and rowing on the Thames.
